intro: Bulbinella capillaris, commonly known as the slender bulbinella, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It produces delicate, pale yellow or greenish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is generally a low-growing perennial herb.
